Description: Rim and wall sherd of pottery cup, possibly a one-handler or kantharos-style cup, with a slight ridge at the transition to the rim; very micaceous, light beige-orange clay, with matt red slip or glaze on outside; inside smoothed.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AP2
Curator's comments: Marked 'AP2' in pencil. Probably from same vase as British Museum 1965,0930. 748,749, 751 and Boston MFA 86.932 (although the latter is marked in pencil '6')
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.217)
